titles.title: A bill to authorize the Air Force Memorial Foundation to establish a memorial in the District of Columbia or its environs.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S1189)
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.

committee.name: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

action.text: Referred to Subcommittee on Public Lands, National Parks.

committee.name: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

action.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources requested executive comment from Department of the Interior, and Office of Management and Budget.

committee.name: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

action.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources requested executive comment from Department of the Interior, and Office of Management and Budget.

action.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources Subcommittee on National Parks. Hearings held. With printed Hearing: S.Hrg. 103-463.

committee.name: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

calendar.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Ordered to be reported with an amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Reported to Senate by Senator Johnston with an amendment. Without written report.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 288.

action.text: By Senator Johnston from Committee on Energy and Natural Resources filed written report under the authority of the order of Nov 17, 93. Report No. 103-210.
Indefinitely postponed by Senate by Unanimous Consent.

committee.name: Senate Energy and Natural Resources
committee.subcommittee: Public Lands, National Parks and Forests

bill.summary: 11/17/1993--Reported to Senate amended. Authorizes the Air Force Memorial Foundation to establish a memorial on Federal land in the District of Columbia or its environs to honor the men and women who have served in the U.S. Air Force. Extends the authorization of the Black Revolutionary War Patriots Foundation to establish a memorial on Federal land in the District of Columbia to October 27, 1996. Extends the authority of the Women in Military Service for America Foundation to establish a memorial on Federal land in the District of Columbia to November 5, 1996.
